patient_information: Age: 52 years Sex: male Comorbidities: none reported Immunosuppression: none reported Vaccinations: none reported Allergies: none reported
chief_complaint: Problem: fever for the past 2 days Duration: past 2 days
history_of_present_illness: Timeline: fever for the past 2 days, night sweats, frontal headache Key symptoms: fever, night sweats, frontal headache Pertinent negatives: no joint pains, no rash Severity pattern: acute febrile illness
exposure_and_epidemiology: Residence travel: recent travel to South Africa Vectors: mosquito exposure implied by endemic setting Animals: none reported Water food risks: none reported Contacts: none reported Season outbreak context: travel to malaria-endemic region Occupation: safari tour
vitals: Temperature: 37.5°C (99.5°F) Pulse: 80 bpm Blood pressure: 130/70 mmHg Jaundice: none reported Neck supple: yes Lymph nodes: {"left_groin": "enlarged"}
physical_exam: General condition: fair Skin: small necrotic skin lesion on upper thigh with surrounding inflammation and lymphangiitis Heent: none reported Chest: none reported Abdo: none reported Neuro: none reported Lymph: {"left_groin": "enlarged"}
labs_and_diagnostics: Cbc: {"platelets": "normal", "leukocytes": "normal"} Microbiology serology pcr: {"PCR from eschar scab": "negative for malaria", "malaria rapid diagnostic test (RDT)": "negative", "thick and thin film for malaria": "negative"}
differential_diagnosis: Considered: ["African tick-bite fever", "other rickettsial infections", "malaria"] Reasons for consideration: {"African tick-bite fever": "clinical presentation, travel history to malaria-endemic region", "other rickettsial infections": "compatible symptoms and travel history", "malaria": "negative diagnostic tests for malaria"}
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: {"antimicrobial": "doxycycline at 100 mg bid PO for 7 days", "supportive_care": "oral/IV fluids, acetaminophen"} Response: fever settled within next few days, lymphadenopathy subsided Outcome: eschar healed after about 2 weeks
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: African tick-bite fever (ATBF) Causative agent: Rickettsia africae Confirmation method: PCR from eschar scab, negative malaria diagnostic tests Diagnostic evidence: clinical presentation, travel history to malaria-endemic region
